intro: Parietaria judaica var. satureiifolia, commonly known as the Jerusalem plant or Jewish plant, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is a low-growing perennial that typically reaches heights of about 10–30 centimeters. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers arranged in dense clusters, which bloom from spring to early summer. Its leaves are heart-shaped and covered with fine hairs, giving them a distinctive texture. It thrives in rocky or disturbed soils and is often found in coastal areas and urban environments.
